intro: Swallenochloa depauperata, commonly known as the sparse-leaved grass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within the grass family.
